p: We identified 776 areas in Brazil ( Fig. 2A) that are home of 2,354 microendemic species of seed plants ( Table S1). These areas with microendemics range from 9.1 km 2 to 24,885 km 2 (median =898.3 km 2, lower quartile =297.9 km 2, upper quartile = 2,183 km 2) and, together, cover 1,491,445 km 2 or 17.5% of Brazil. They are found in all six Brazilian domains ( Fig. 2A), but most of them (39%) are in the Atlantic Forest. Each area shelters between one and 126 microendemics, but most of them (59%) have only one ( Fig. 2A). The areas with the highest number of microendemics are mainly found along the central Atlantic Forest and the high plateaus in Cerrado and Caatinga ( Fig. 2A).
